channel.title: Update, BCEL and de-obsfucation
channel.description:
I had a few questions.
[ul][li]How often does Jagex update the client so that I would have to update my BCEL code?[/li] [li]when using BCEL, do I "need" to deob runescape, or is that for re-compiling and/or easier reading of the source?[/li][/ul]
And finally, questions with BCEL directly.
[ul][li]Is it better to load the runescape.jar realtime and edit it then with BCEL, or store the client on my HD and edit it with BCEL?[/li]
[li]Could someone help me understand how classes interact. Mainly how to get entity information, like names, HP, items being worn, world position and possibly even current emote being animated...?[/li][/ul]
My intent is to provide enough information to get a near perfect walker. Entity information has a billion and one uses as well

item.title: Update, BCEL and de-obsfucation
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“BAsh(CntLgn), post:11, topic:140907”]Maybe I should be a bit more specific.

You are not going to get any source code from the client that actually compiles. Any client edits have to be done in byte code.

That is why Aryan did not decompile the single “bad class”. It instead used hooks in other classes to get the appropriate variables.[/quote]when i decompile i use jad, then use jode for any code that didnt get decompiled properly

that said, if all you want to do is look at the code, you dont need it to recompilable anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Update, BCEL and de-obsfucation
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Exception:

I have a feeling Jode has some significance here, but I could be making an idiot out of myself again.

Jode throws stack depth exceptions because of the recursive way it decompiles.

Read full topic

@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Maybe I should be a bit more specific.

You are not going to get any source code from the client that actually compiles. Any client edits have to be done in byte code.

That is why Aryan did not decompile the single “bad class”. It instead used hooks in other classes to get the appropriate variables.

item.title: Update, BCEL and de-obsfucation
item.dc:creator: @martingon martingon
item.description:
@martingon wrote:

Bash, I think a debugger sounds easy if I want to access local player information (character stats, etc. etc.)

But as for remote player information (other players stats) that’s very dynamic, so I would need to actually hook into the Entity and the code that spawns Entity classes.

Frank, I’m going to have to mix dynamic and static. Unless of course someone can point me off to the entity class. All I see is class1, class2, class3 etc. etc.

I deob’d with popcorns deob’er

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


[br][size=1]Posted on: September 07, 2007, 02:41:47 PM[/size][hr]Ok having problems with this block of code, it has goto statements, and I can’t find a deob’er to get fix it. (and I don’t have the mental capacity to fix it… is tired)

public static boolean method246(byte abyte0[], int i, boolean flag, int j)
	{
		boolean flag1;
		Class7_Sub15 class7_sub15;
		int k;
		anInt2975++;
		class7_sub15 = new Class7_Sub15(abyte0);
		flag1 = flag;
		k = -1;
_L2:
		int i1;
		boolean flag2;
		int l = class7_sub15.method600((byte)109);
		if(l == 0)
			break MISSING_BLOCK_LABEL_261;
		k += l;
		i1 = 0;
		flag2 = false;
_L3:
		int j1;
		if(flag2)
			break MISSING_BLOCK_LABEL_232;
		j1 = class7_sub15.method600((byte)109);
		if(~j1 == -1) goto _L2; else goto _L1
_L1:
		i1 += j1 + -1;
		int l1 = 0x3f & i1 >> 0xc19e40e6;
		int j2 = i + l1;
		int k1 = 0x3f & i1;
		int i2 = class7_sub15.method610(-15447) >> 0xfebcb0a2;
		int k2 = j + k1;
		if(j2 > 0 && ~k2 < -1 && ~j2 > -104 && ~k2 > -104)
		{
			Class7_Sub8_Sub7 class7_sub8_sub7 = Class75.method1197(-2, k);
			if(~i2 != -23 || !Class7_Sub19.aBoolean2389 || class7_sub8_sub7.anInt2842 != 0 || class7_sub8_sub7.anInt2835 == 1 || class7_sub8_sub7.aBoolean2819)
			{
				flag2 = true;
				if(!class7_sub8_sub7.method203(-8118))
				{
					Class7_Sub14_Sub1.anInt3107++;
					flag1 = false;
				}
			}
		}
		  goto _L3
		j1 = class7_sub15.method600((byte)109);
		if(j1 == 0) goto _L2; else goto _L4
_L4:
		class7_sub15.method610(-15447);
		  goto _L3
		return flag1;
	}

item.title: Update, BCEL and de-obsfucation
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

or dont be a noob and use JDI

IMO it is easier to get hooks using static analysis, because then you will actually learn how the client works (unless you are a twat and just leech other peoples methods)

Read full topic

item.title: Update, BCEL and de-obsfucation
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

  1. Depends on if your bcel code breaks, if you write it well, it wont, otherwise, you will be fixing every update
    but that fixing is part of making an updater, everyone has to do it, try it on previous version to check as well.

  2. No, deobing is only if you want to decompile it, with bcel, you dont need to decompile.

  3. I think its better to store them on your HD, cause you dont have to wait everytime you start your program

  4. That takes ages and ages to explain, and even then it wouldnt be perfect. I think the best way is to get a deob and start looking around, editing stuff, see what it does.
    Tip with current emote: Look for Entity.animationID

Read full topic
